WorkItem.Description: I really need a mechanism from Prism which allow Prism-based application being able to navigate to a page opened in a separate window. I check the Prism document Chapter 7 Navagation, looks the navagation avaliable in the Prism are either State-based or View-based, the latter is quite close to what I am looking for. But it is still the navagation inside the one window. Will Prism provide this capability in Silverlight? Note, the page(view) hosted in a "new window" means that it is not "Modal" child window. The "new window" is more like a new shell to host necessary views(pages), it should like a "sibling" to origial shell window.
WorkItem.Summary: Navigation: Will Prism allow opening "new window" style navigation in Siverlight?

Comments.Message:
The way we would handle this in Prism is to have a region with a popup or create-new-window behavior.  We demonstrate this approch in the StockTraderRI and reading the news articles.  In the RI, the RegionPopupBehaviors creates a region that shows or updates the contents of Window based on the items in a region.

HTH,

-b
